meanings.definition: To bring to a state of perfection or fulfillment
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, they were finally consummating their dream of owning a home.
meanings.sent2: The chef was consummating the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent3: The team's victory in the championship game was like consummating a fairy tale ending.
meanings.sent4: The artist was consummating her masterpiece with the final brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: The sunset over the ocean was a consummating moment of beauty.

meanings.definition: To complete a marriage with sexual intercourse
meanings.sent1: The couple was consummating their marriage in a private ceremony.
meanings.sent2: In many cultures, it is customary to consummate a marriage on the wedding night.
meanings.sent3: The newlyweds joked about consummating their marriage with a high-five.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ritual required the couple to consummate their union under the full moon.
meanings.sent5: The act of consummating their love sealed their bond forever.

meanings.definition: To make a marriage or relationship complete by having sexual intercourse
meanings.sent1: They believed consummating their relationship would solidify their commitment.
meanings.sent2: The couple decided to consummate their love on their anniversary.
meanings.sent3: The romantic comedy ended with the main characters consummating their quirky relationship.
meanings.sent4: The birds chirping outside seemed to celebrate the couple consummating their love.
meanings.sent5: The stars aligned perfectly on the night they were consummating their relationship.
